nodes.documentation:
The supplier reedems the BNDESToken by transfering the tokens to a specific address, 
called Redemption address. 
By default, the redemption address is the address of the owner. 
The owner can change the redemption address using this function. 
@param rs new Redemption address
nodes.name: setRedemptionAddress

nodes.documentation: @param rs Ethereum address to be assigned to the token address.

nodes.documentation:
The supplier reedems the BNDESToken by transfering the tokens to a specific address, 
called Redemption address. 
By default, the redemption address is the address of the owner. 
The owner can change the redemption address using this function. 
@param rs new Redemption address
nodes.name: setRedemptionAddress

nodes.documentation: @param rs Ethereum address to be assigned to the token address.
nodes.name: setTokenAddress

@param rs account that can be changed.
nodes.name: enableChangeAccount

params.idFinancialSupportAgreement: contract number of financial contract with BNDES. It assumes 0 if it is a supplier.
params.idProofHash: The legal entities have to send BNDES a PDF where it assumes as responsible for an Ethereum account.                   This PDF is signed with eCNPJ and send to BNDES.
params.newAddr: the new address to be associated with the legal entity
params.salic: contract number of financial contract with ANCINE. It assumes 0 if it is a supplier.

params.addr: Ethereum address that needs to be validated

isOwner().return: true if `msg.sender` is the owner of the contract.

params.addr: the address to be associated with the legal entity.
params.idFinancialSupportAgreement: contract number of financial contract with BNDES. It assumes 0 if it is a supplier.
params.idProofHash: The legal entities have to send BNDES a PDF where it assumes as responsible for an Ethereum account.                   This PDF is signed with eCNPJ and send to BNDES.
params.salic: contract number of financial contract with ANCINE. It assumes 0 if it is a supplier.

renounceOwnership().details: Allows the current owner to relinquish control of the contract.

params.rs: Ethereum address to be assigned as Responsible for Disbursment.
Ethereum address to be assigned as Responsible for Validation.
Ethereum address to be assigned as Responsible for Settlement.
Ethereum address to be assigned to the token address.

transferOwnership(address).details: Allows the current owner to transfer control of the contract to a newOwner.

params.newOwner: The address to transfer ownership to.

params.addr: Ethereum address that needs to be validated
params.idProofHash: The legal entities have to send BNDES a PDF where it assumes as responsible for an Ethereum account.                   This PDF is signed with eCNPJ and send to BNDES.

changeAccountLegalEntity(uint64,uint64,u.notice: Changes the original link between CNPJ and Ethereum account.  The new link still needs to be validated by BNDES. This method can only be called by BNDESToken contract because BNDESToken can pause and because there are  additional instructions there.

enableChangeAccount(address).notice: Enable the legal entity to change the account

invalidateRegistryLegalEntity(address).notice: Invalidates the initial registry of a legal entity or the change of its registry The invalidation can be called at any time in the lifecycle of the address (not only when it is WAITING_VALIDATION)

registryLegalEntity(uint64,uint64,uint32.notice: Link blockchain address with CNPJ - It can be a cliente or a supplier The link still needs to be validated by BNDES This method can only be called by BNDESToken contract because BNDESToken can pause.

renounceOwnership().notice: Renouncing to ownership will leave the contract without an owner. It will not be possible to call the functions with the `onlyOwner` modifier anymore.

setRedemptionAddress(address).notice: The supplier reedems the BNDESToken by transfering the tokens to a specific address,  called Redemption address.  By default, the redemption address is the address of the owner.  The owner can change the redemption address using this function.

setResponsibleForDisbursement(address).notice: By default, the owner is also the Responsible for Disbursment.  The owner can assign other address to be the Responsible for Disbursment.

setResponsibleForRegistryValidation(addr.notice: By default, the owner is also the Responsible for Validation.  The owner can assign other address to be the Responsible for Validation.

setResponsibleForSettlement(address).notice: By default, the owner is also the Responsible for Settlement.  The owner can assign other address to be the Responsible for Settlement.

validateRegistryLegalEntity(address,stri.notice: Validates the initial registry of a legal entity or the change of its registry
